entry.title: PrivacyBlur
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion).
---------------------
### Link to the source code: https://github.com/MATHEMA-GmbH/privacyblur
### Link to app in another app store: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.mathema.privacyblur
https://apps.apple.com/us/app/privacyblur/id1536274106
### License used: [MIT](https://github.com/MATHEMA-GmbH/privacyblur/blob/main/LICENSE)
### Category: Photography
### Summary: A cross-platform application to obfuscate sensitive data from images, targeting iOS and Android devices. Mainly written in dart with the Flutter SDK.
### Description: PrivacyBlur does one thing only and does it well: blur or pixelate areas of your images with a few finger taps. Hide kids, faces, documents, numbers, names, etc., from your pictures in mere seconds. With PrivacyBlur at your side, you can share your pictures online without second thoughts.
Faces can be detected automatically. This happens on your phone, the image is not sent to any server.
No in-app purchases. No ads. No watermark. No hassle. Free forever because privacy shouldn't cost anything.
Features: - Blur / Pixelate effect - Faces can be detected automatically - Fine / coarse grain effect - Round / Square area - Export to your camera roll
entry.content:

---------------------

https://apps.apple.com/us/app/privacyblur/id1536274106
### License used: [MIT](https://github.com/MATHEMA-GmbH/privacyblur/blob/main/LICENSE)
### Category: Photography
### Summary: A cross-platform application to obfuscate sensitive data from images, targeting iOS and Android devices. Mainly written in dart with the Flutter SDK.
### Description: PrivacyBlur does one thing only and does it well: blur or pixelate areas of your images with a few finger taps. Hide kids, faces, documents, numbers, names, etc., from your pictures in mere seconds. With PrivacyBlur at your side, you can share your pictures online without second thoughts.
Faces can be detected automatically. This happens on your phone, the image is not sent to any server.
No in-app purchases. No ads. No watermark. No hassle. Free forever because privacy shouldn't cost anything.
Features: - Blur / Pixelate effect - Faces can be detected automatically - Fine / coarse grain effect - Round / Square area - Export to your camera roll

entry.title: Grafobook
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
# Link to the source code: https://github.com/ByteSeb/Grafobook # Link to app in another app store: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.byteseb.grafobook # License used: [Apache License 2.0](https://github.com/ByteSeb/Grafobook/blob/main/LICENSE.md) # Category: Writing # Summary: An offline note taking app with rich text support # Description: Grafobook is a free, open source and offline note-taking application for Android.
Features
* Note taking with rich text support (bold, italics, underline, strikethrough...). * Organize notes with favorite notes, multiple tags and colors. * Search with filters and sorting. * Customize the application to match with your preferences.
The minimum SDK version is 24 (Android Nougat) and the app is fully translated to english and spanish.
entry.content:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.

Features
* Note taking with rich text support (bold, italics, underline, strikethrough...). * Organize notes with favorite notes, multiple tags and colors. * Search with filters and sorting. * Customize the application to match with your preferences.
The minimum SDK version is 24 (Android Nougat) and the app is fully translated to english and spanish.

entry.title: New Zealand Covid Tracer App
entry.description:
* [X] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [X] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [X] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
### Link to the source code: https://github.com/minhealthnz/nzcovidtracer-app ### Link to app in another app store: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=nz.govt.health.covidtracer ### License used: GNU Affero General Public License (3 or greater) https://github.com/minhealthnz/nzcovidtracer-app/blob/main/LICENCE ### Category: Sports & Health ### Summary: New Zealand COVID-19 Tracer App ### Description: NZ COVID Tracer is a Ministry of Health app that allows you to create a digital diary of places you visit by scanning the official QR codes. This gives contact tracers a headstart with identifying anyone who may have been exposed to COVID-19 so we can quickly break the chain of transmission.
entry.content:

This gives contact tracers a headstart with identifying anyone who may have been exposed to COVID-19 so we can quickly break the chain of transmission.

entry.title: Auxio
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). (Ok, [see comments](https://github.com/OxygenCobalt/Auxio/issues/21)) * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
### Link to the source code:
https://github.com/OxygenCobalt/Auxio
### Link to app in another app store:
https://apt.izzysoft.de/fdroid/index/apk/org.oxycblt.auxio (izzysoft F-Droid)
### License used:
[GPL-3.0](https://github.com/OxygenCobalt/Auxio/blob/dev/LICENSE)
### Category:
Multimedia
### Summary:
A simple, rational music player for android.
### Description:
Auxio is a local music player with a fast, reliable UI/UX without the many useless features present in other music players. Built off of Exoplayer, Auxio has a much better listening experience compared to other apps that use the native MediaPlayer API. In short, It plays music.
entry.content:

### Category:
Multimedia

Auxio is a local music player with a fast, reliable UI/UX without the many useless features present in other music players. Built off of Exoplayer, Auxio has a much better listening experience compared to other apps that use the native MediaPlayer API. In short, It plays music.

entry.title: AnXray
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [ ] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). @nekohasekai * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
### Link to the source code: https://github.com/XTLS/AnXray (https://github.com/XTLS/AnXray/dev)
### Link to app in another app store: None
### License used: GPL-3.0 or later
### Category: Connectivity/Internet
### Summary: Another Xray for Android.
### Description:
A fork of [SagerNet](https://github.com/SagerNet/SagerNet) (see https://gitlab.com/fdroid/rfp/-/issues/1719) with the Xray core inside. The application is designed to be used whenever possible.
#### Proxy
* SOCKS * HTTP(S) * Shadowsocks * ShadowsocksR * VMess * VLESS with XTLS support * Trojan with XTLS support * Trojan-Go ( trojan-go-plugin ) * NaïveProxy ( naive-plugin ) * Ping Tunnel ( pingtunnel-plugin ) * relaybaton ( relaybaton-plugin ) * Brook ( brook-plugin )
#### Subscription
* Universal base64 format * Shadowsocks SIP008 * Just My Socks' proprietary format * Clash
#### Features
* Full basic features * Xray WebSocket browser dialer * Option to change the notification update interval * A Chinese apps scanner (based on dex classpath scanning, so it may be slower) * Proxy chain * Advanced routing with outbound profile selection * Reverse proxy * Custom config (Xray / Trojan-Go)
entry.content:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [ ] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). @nekohasekai * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------

### License used: GPL-3.0 or later
### Category: Connectivity/Internet
### Summary: Another Xray for Android.
### Description:
A fork of [SagerNet](https://github.com/SagerNet/SagerNet) (see https://gitlab.com/fdroid/rfp/-/issues/1719) with the Xray core inside. The application is designed to be used whenever possible.
#### Proxy
* SOCKS * HTTP(S) * Shadowsocks * ShadowsocksR * VMess * VLESS with XTLS support * Trojan with XTLS support * Trojan-Go ( trojan-go-plugin ) * NaïveProxy ( naive-plugin ) * Ping Tunnel ( pingtunnel-plugin ) * relaybaton ( relaybaton-plugin ) * Brook ( brook-plugin )
#### Subscription
* Universal base64 format * Shadowsocks SIP008 * Just My Socks' proprietary format * Clash
#### Features
* Full basic features * Xray WebSocket browser dialer * Option to change the notification update interval * A Chinese apps scanner (based on dex classpath scanning, so it may be slower) * Proxy chain * Advanced routing with outbound profile selection * Reverse proxy * Custom config (Xray / Trojan-Go)

entry.title: Silence
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/docs/Inclusion_Policy/?title=Inclusion_Policy). * [x] The app is not already [listed](https://gitlab.com/search?scope=issues&group_id=28397) in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The app has not already [been requested](https://gitlab.com/search?scope=issues&project_id=2167965) * [x] The upstream app source code repo contains the app metadata _(summary/description/images/changelog/etc)_ in a [Fastlane](https://gitlab.com/snippets/1895688) or [Triple-T](https://gitlab.com/snippets/1901490) folder structure * [x] The original app author has been notified, and does not oppose the inclusion. * [x] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
#### APPLICATION ID: me.lucky.silence ```yaml Categories: - Phone & SMS License: GPL-3.0-only AuthorName: lucky AuthorEmail: 44uaanjm0@relay.firefox.com AuthorWebSite: https://github.com/x13a SourceCode: https://github.com/x13a/Silence IssueTracker: https://github.com/x13a/Silence/issues
AutoName: Silence
RepoType: git Repo: https://github.com/x13a/Silence.git
Builds: - versionName: 1.6.0 versionCode: 10 commit: v1.6.0 subdir: app gradle: - yes
AutoUpdateMode: Version v%v UpdateCheckMode: Tags CurrentVersion: 1.6.0 CurrentVersionCode: 10 ```
Summary & description are provided via Fastlane, hence here just for reference:
```yaml Summary: Filter incoming calls Description: |- Call screening app.
Block phone numbers that are not saved in your contacts list.
Optionally:
* allow numbers that you have called * allow numbers with toll-free codes (ex: 800) * allow a third call from the same number within five minutes (cache constraint) * allow temporary mobile numbers from incoming text messages ```
entry.content:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/docs/Inclusion_Policy/?title=Inclusion_Policy). * [x] The app is not already [listed](https://gitlab.com/search?scope=issues&group_id=28397) in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The app has not already [been requested](https://gitlab.com/search?scope=issues&project_id=2167965) * [x] The upstream app source code repo contains the app metadata _(summary/description/images/changelog/etc)_ in a [Fastlane](https://gitlab.com/snippets/1895688) or [Triple-T](https://gitlab.com/snippets/1901490) folder structure * [x] The original app author has been notified, and does not oppose the inclusion. * [x] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
#### APPLICATION ID: me.lucky.silence ```yaml Categories: - Phone & SMS License: GPL-3.0-only AuthorName: lucky AuthorEmail: 44uaanjm0@relay.firefox.com AuthorWebSite: https://github.com/x13a SourceCode: https://github.com/x13a/Silence IssueTracker: https://github.com/x13a/Silence/issues
AutoName: Silence
RepoType: git Repo: https://github.com/x13a/Silence.git
Builds: - versionName: 1.6.0 versionCode: 10 commit: v1.6.0 subdir: app gradle: - yes
AutoUpdateMode: Version v%v UpdateCheckMode: Tags CurrentVersion: 1.6.0 CurrentVersionCode: 10 ```
Summary & description are provided via Fastlane, hence here just for reference:
```yaml Summary: Filter incoming calls Description: |- Call screening app.
Block phone numbers that are not saved in your contacts list.
Optionally:
* allow numbers that you have called * allow numbers with toll-free codes (ex: 800) * allow a third call from the same number within five minutes (cache constraint) * allow temporary mobile numbers from incoming text messages ```

entry.title: Request for packaging droidVNC-NG
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). (See: https://github.com/bk138/droidVNC-NG/issues/20) * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
### Link to the source code: https://github.com/bk138/droidVNC-NG
### License used: GPL-2.0
### Category: Development
### Summary:
VNC server app for Android that does not require root privileges.
### Description:
This is an Android VNC server using contemporary Android 5+ APIs. It therefore does not require root access. In reverence to the venerable droid-VNC-server is is called droidVNC-NG.
entry.content:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). (See: https://github.com/bk138/droidVNC-NG/issues/20) * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------

### License used: GPL-2.0
### Category: Development
### Summary:
VNC server app for Android that does not require root privileges.
### Description:
This is an Android VNC server using contemporary Android 5+ APIs. It therefore does not require root access. In reverence to the venerable droid-VNC-server is is called droidVNC-NG.

entry.title: Request for packaging EnRecipes - A NativeScript app
entry.summary: Request for packaging EnRecipes - A NativeScript app
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/docs/Inclusion_Policy/?title=Inclusion_Policy). * [x] The app is not already [listed](https://gitlab.com/search?scope=issues&group_id=28397) in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The app has not already [been requested](https://gitlab.com/search?scope=issues&project_id=2167965) * [x] The upstream app source code repo contains the app metadata _(summary/description/images/changelog/etc)_ in a [Fastlane](https://gitlab.com/snippets/1895688) or [Triple-T](https://gitlab.com/snippets/1901490) folder structure * [x] The original app author has been notified, and does not oppose the inclusion. * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
The first step is to find the app's [_Application ID_](https://developer.android.com/studio/build/application-id.html). This is usually the same as the app's _Package Name_. You will find it in files called _AndroidManifest.xml_ or _build.gradle_ most of the time. You can also see it in the URLs for the app's page in various app stores. Write it here:
#### APPLICATION ID: com.vishnuraghav.EnRecipes
Below is a template "metadata file" to fill out, it has only the required fields. F-Droid uses this file to build and publish the app. [Build Metadata Reference](https://f-droid.org/docs/Build_Metadata_Reference) documents all available options. Add values after the colon
```yaml # Categories (one per line, each starting with a space and a minus), chosen from the # official list: https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/blob/master/stats/categories.txt Categories: - Sports & Health
# the one license that the whole app is available under, use # https://spdx.org/licenses/ short identifiers, must be # floss-compatible. License: GPL-3.0-only
# You can provide details on how to contact the author. These are optional, but # nice to have. AuthorName: Vishnu Raghav B AuthorEmail: apps@vishnuraghav.com AuthorWebSite: https://www.vishnuraghav.com
# A URL for the project's website, and to the source code repository to visit # using a web browser. WebSite is optional. WebSite: https://enrecipes.vercel.app SourceCode: https://github.com/vishnuraghavb/EnRecipes
# A link to the issue tracker where bugs are reported IssueTracker: https://github.com/vishnuraghavb/EnRecipes/issues
# If available, you can also provide links/IDs for donations. Donate: https://www.vishnuraghav.com/donate Bitcoin: bc1qjxwecmmajnl7qvyzwqqka60tfvcyj9qhy2lpq8 LiberaPay: vishnuraghavb
# Name of the application AutoName: EnRecipes
# Repository details to be used by VCS (Version Control Systems) # git, git-svn, svn, hg or bzr RepoType: git
# source code repo URL (HTTPS required) Repo: https://github.com/vishnuraghavb/EnRecipes.git ```
entry.content:

---------------------
The first step is to find the app's [_Application ID_](https://developer.android.com/studio/build/application-id.html). This is usually the same as the app's _Package Name_. You will find it in files called _AndroidManifest.xml_ or _build.gradle_ most of the time. You can also see it in the URLs for the app's page in various app stores. Write it here:

```yaml # Categories (one per line, each starting with a space and a minus), chosen from the # official list: https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/blob/master/stats/categories.txt Categories: - Sports & Health

# Name of the application AutoName: EnRecipes

entry.title: MHD Virtual Table
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
### Link to the source code: https://github.com/magicsk/mhd_virtual_table
### Link to app in another app store:
### License used: MPL-2.0
### Category: Navigation
### Summary: Virtual tables list for MHD in Bratislava.
### Description:
MHD Virtual Table include list of all stops and their virtual tables.
You can also view nearest stop or list of few nearest stops around you. If this is not enough, you can also plan a trip via public transport, all whitin this app.
entry.content:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.

### Link to the source code: https://github.com/magicsk/mhd_virtual_table
### Link to app in another app store:
### License used: MPL-2.0
### Category: Navigation
### Summary: Virtual tables list for MHD in Bratislava.
### Description:
MHD Virtual Table include list of all stops and their virtual tables.
You can also view nearest stop or list of few nearest stops around you. If this is not enough, you can also plan a trip via public transport, all whitin this app.

entry.title: DTC Bus Tracker
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
### Link to the source code: https://github.com/delhitransit/delhitransit-android ### Link to app in another app store:
### License used: GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE - Version 3 ### Category: Navigation ### Summary: DTC Bus Tracker is displaying public transit information like distance, routes, stops, timings, etc related to DTC Buses in a user-friendly UI ### Description: DTC Bus Tracker is a server and client app that displays information like distance, routes, stops, timings, etc related to DTC Buses in a user-friendly UI based on Android which is backboned by our servers based on Java SpringBoot and database management by PostgreSQL.
Our server manages the real large and heavy raw data coming right from the Delhi Government containing information about buses. The server performs various tasks like parsing raw data to Java objects which can further be used to create a database, finding ways to travel within different bus stops, finding the most optimal route, etc. After these tasks, the last thing a server can do is creating APIs. - When a user launches the app, the app will check for location services and request the user location to get the bus stops near his/her location. - When a user launches the app, it also checks for the server whether it is online or offline and it notifies that the server is offline. - On launch, the app also checks for the Wi-Fi or data services are turned on so that the app is ready to request data from the server. - After launch, the app displays a map and search box to search the routes available between a source and destination stop. - After the search, the results are displayed in a bottom sheet in which the user can further see the route plotting on the map for each bus. - User can mark some stops as favorites or most visited so that he/she doesn't need to type in the search. - On clicking a particular stop on the map displays the list of buses that will pass through that stop in the upcoming time.
entry.content:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). * [ ] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
### Link to the source code: https://github.com/delhitransit/delhitransit-android ### Link to app in another app store:
### License used: GNU GENERAL PUBLIC LICENSE - Version 3 ### Category: Navigation ### Summary: DTC Bus Tracker is displaying public transit information like distance, routes, stops, timings, etc related to DTC Buses in a user-friendly UI ### Description: DTC Bus Tracker is a server and client app that displays information like distance, routes, stops, timings, etc related to DTC Buses in a user-friendly UI based on Android which is backboned by our servers based on Java SpringBoot and database management by PostgreSQL.
Our server manages the real large and heavy raw data coming right from the Delhi Government containing information about buses. The server performs various tasks like parsing raw data to Java objects which can further be used to create a database, finding ways to travel within different bus stops, finding the most optimal route, etc. After these tasks, the last thing a server can do is creating APIs. - When a user launches the app, the app will check for location services and request the user location to get the bus stops near his/her location. - When a user launches the app, it also checks for the server whether it is online or offline and it notifies that the server is offline. - On launch, the app also checks for the Wi-Fi or data services are turned on so that the app is ready to request data from the server. - After launch, the app displays a map and search box to search the routes available between a source and destination stop. - After the search, the results are displayed in a bottom sheet in which the user can further see the route plotting on the map for each bus. - User can mark some stops as favorites or most visited so that he/she doesn't need to type in the search. - On clicking a particular stop on the map displays the list of buses that will pass through that stop in the upcoming time.

entry.title: Bluetooth GNSS
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Inclusion_Policy) * [x] The app is not already listed in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The original app author has been notified (and does not oppose the inclusion). (github.com:ykasidit/bluetooth_gnss/issues/2)
---------------------
### Link to the source code: https://github.com/ykasidit/bluetooth_gnss
(engine used: github.com:ykasidit/libbluetooth_gnss)
### Link to app in another app store: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.clearevo.bluetooth_gnss&hl=en_US&gl=US
### License used: GPLv2 or later
### Category: navigation
### Summary: Connect your Android phone to external Bluetooth GPS, GLONASS, Galileo and BeiDou receivers and use their location.
### Description: Use this app to get more accurate positioning data (latitude, longitude, elevation...) from external 'Bluetooth GNSS Receivers' (like 'EcoDroidGPS', 'HOLUX', 'Garmin GLO' etc) and use it as the position for apps in this phone (like Waze, etc) via 'Mock location app' Android Developer Settings. Requires mock locations.
This app is similar to BlueGPS, but more modern and working: BlueGps (Connect a GPS via Bluetooth) - https://f-droid.org/packages/org.broeuschmeul.android.gps.bluetooth.provider

entry.title: https://github.com/Superredstone/Port-Scanner
entry.description:
* [x] The app complies with the [inclusion criteria](https://f-droid.org/docs/Inclusion_Policy/?title=Inclusion_Policy). * [x] The app is not already [listed](https://gitlab.com/search?scope=issues&group_id=28397) in the repo or issue tracker. * [x] The app has not already [been requested](https://gitlab.com/search?scope=issues&project_id=2167965) * [x] The upstream app source code repo contains the app metadata _(summary/description/images/changelog/etc)_ in a [Fastlane](https://gitlab.com/snippets/1895688) or [Triple-T](https://gitlab.com/snippets/1901490) folder structure * [x] The original app author has been notified, and does not oppose the inclusion. * [x] [Donated](https://f-droid.org/donate/) to support the maintenance of this app in F-Droid.
---------------------
The first step is to find the app's [_Application ID_](https://developer.android.com/studio/build/application-id.html). This is usually the same as the app's _Package Name_. You will find it in files called _AndroidManifest.xml_ or _build.gradle_ most of the time. You can also see it in the URLs for the app's page in various app stores. Write it here:
#### APPLICATION ID: com.portscanner.superredstone
Below is a template "metadata file" to fill out, it has only the required fields. F-Droid uses this file to build and publish the app. [Build Metadata Reference](https://f-droid.org/docs/Build_Metadata_Reference) documents all available options. Add values after the colon
```yaml Categories: - Security - Internet License: GPL-3.0-only AuthorName: Superredstone AuthorWebSite: https://superredstone.github.io/ SourceCode: https://github.com/Superredstone/Port-Scanner IssueTracker: https://github.com/Superredstone/Port-Scanner/issues Changelog: https://github.com/Superredstone/Port-Scanner/releases Donate: https://ko-fi.com/Superredstone123
AutoName: Port Scanner
Summary: Cross platform port scanner written in Golang Description: |- A simple open source port scanning application for penetration testing purposes. It supports ONLY tcp connections
RepoType: git Repo: https://github.com/Superredstone/Port-Scanner
```

```yaml Categories: - Security - Internet License: GPL-3.0-only AuthorName: Superredstone AuthorWebSite: https://superredstone.github.io/ SourceCode: https://github.com/Superredstone/Port-Scanner IssueTracker: https://github.com/Superredstone/Port-Scanner/issues Changelog: https://github.com/Superredstone/Port-Scanner/releases Donate: https://ko-fi.com/Superredstone123
